verb.description: Decorate (cloth) by sewing patterns on it with thread.
examples: she was teaching one of the girls how to embroider
she had already embroidered a dozen little nighties for the babies

verb.description: Add fictitious or exaggerated details to (an account) to make it more interesting.
examples: she embroidered her stories with colorful detail

origin: Late Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French enbrouder, from en- in, on + Old French brouder, broisder decorate with embroidery, of Germanic origin.
